definition:
A is a $ (V,E) $ such that there exists an $ M \in \mathbb{N} $ such
that for every $ x \in V $ we have that the degree of $ x $, also
denoted $ \rho(x) $, is at most $ M $. In other words there exists an
$ M \in \mathbb{N} $ such that for every
$ x \in V \, , \, \rho(x) \le M $.

Note that the examples provided in are also examples of a uniformly
locally finite graph since both graphs are and have finite at each
vertex.
